Fields

RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS 

public const double RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS = 17

Field Value

double

Properties

IsGUI

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the program using this API is a GUI application. Set to true for GUI applications (WPF, WinForms), false for console or headless applications.

public static bool IsGUI { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

Examples

// For a GUI application
API.IsGUI = true;

// For a console application
API.IsGUI = false;

Remarks

This affects how the radio treats the client and may influence connection behavior. GUI clients are typically managed differently by the radio than non-GUI clients.

ProgramName

Gets or sets the name of the program that is using this API. This name is sent to the radio during connection and may be displayed by the radio or other clients.

public static string ProgramName { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Examples

API.ProgramName = "MyFlexRadioApp";

Remarks

This property must be set before calling Init().

RadioList

Gets a list of all FlexRadio devices discovered on the network.

public static List<Radio> RadioList { get; }

Property Value

List<Radio>

Examples

API.Init();
await Task.Delay(2000); // Wait for discovery

foreach (var radio in API.RadioList)
{
    Console.WriteLine($"Found: {radio.Nickname} ({radio.Model})");
}

Remarks

This list is automatically populated as radios are discovered via UDP broadcast. Radios that do not send discovery packets for RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS seconds are automatically removed from the list.

Subscribe to RadioAdded and RadioRemoved events to be notified when radios are added or removed from this list.

Methods

CloseSession()

Closes the API session and cleans up all resources.

public static void CloseSession()

Examples

try
{
    API.Init();
    // Your application code
}
finally
{
    API.CloseSession(); // Always cleanup
}

Remarks

This method should be called when your application is shutting down. It performs the following:

  • Stops radio discovery
  • Disconnects from all connected radios
  • Removes all radios from the RadioList
  • Releases network resources

After calling this method, you can call Init() again to restart the API.

See Also
Init()

Init()

Initializes the FlexLib API and starts radio discovery on the network.

public static void Init()

Examples

API.ProgramName = "MyFlexRadioApp";
API.IsGUI = true;

// Subscribe to events before Init() to catch all discoveries
API.RadioAdded += (radio) => Console.WriteLine($"Found: {radio.Nickname}");

API.Init();

Remarks

This method must be called before using any FlexLib functionality. It performs the following:

  • Opens a UDP socket for radio discovery on port 4992
  • Starts listening for radio discovery broadcasts
  • Initializes the WAN server for remote radio access
  • Starts a cleanup timer to remove stale radios

This method is thread-safe and can be called multiple times. Subsequent calls after the first initialization are ignored.

ProgramName should be set before calling this method.

See Also
CloseSession()
RadioAdded
RadioList

Events

RadioAdded

Occurs when a new FlexRadio device is discovered on the network.

public static event API.RadioAddedEventHandler RadioAdded

Event Type

API.RadioAddedEventHandler

Examples

API.RadioAdded += (radio) =>
{
    Console.WriteLine($"Discovered: {radio.Nickname} at {radio.IP}");

    // Optionally connect to the radio
    if (radio.Available)
    {
        radio.Connect();
    }
};

API.Init();

Remarks

This event is fired when a radio sends a discovery packet and is added to the RadioList. The radio is not connected at this point, only discovered.

Subscribe to this event before calling Init() to ensure you don't miss any radio discoveries.

Event handlers are invoked on a background thread. Use appropriate thread synchronization if updating UI elements.

See Also
RadioRemoved
RadioList

RadioChangedIp

Occurs when a radio's IP address changes on the network.

public static event API.RadioChangedIpEventHandler RadioChangedIp

Event Type

API.RadioChangedIpEventHandler

Examples

API.RadioChangedIp += (radio) =>
{
    Console.WriteLine($"Radio {radio.Nickname} changed IP to {radio.IP}");
};

Remarks

This event is fired when a radio is detected with the same serial number but a different IP address than previously discovered. This can occur when the radio obtains a new DHCP lease or its network configuration changes.

RadioRemoved

Occurs when a FlexRadio device is removed from the network or times out.

public static event API.RadioRemovedEventHandler RadioRemoved

Event Type

API.RadioRemovedEventHandler

Examples

API.RadioRemoved += (radio) =>
{
    Console.WriteLine($"Lost connection to: {radio.Nickname}");
};

Remarks

This event is fired when a radio stops sending discovery packets for RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS seconds, or when the radio is manually removed from the list.

Event handlers are invoked on a background thread.

See Also
RadioAdded

WanListReceived

Occurs when the list of WAN-accessible radios is received from the WAN server.

public static event API.WanListReceivedEventHandler WanListReceived

Event Type

API.WanListReceivedEventHandler

Examples

API.WanListReceived += (radios) =>
{
    foreach (var radio in radios)
    {
        Console.WriteLine($"Remote radio: {radio.Nickname}");
    }
};

Remarks

This event is fired when connecting to a WAN server and receiving the list of remotely accessible radios. Subscribe to this event to be notified of available remote radios.
